result.name: private-registered-provider-housing-in-our-area1
result.notes:
This data is based on the Homes and Communities Agency (HCA) Statistical Data Return (SDR).
It provides a list of Private Registered Providers (including registered social landlords, housing associations, almshouses etc) who own and manage homes in the Cambridge housing sub-region and Peterborough.

The 2013-14 data includes a simple yes/no as to whether providers own general needs, supported housing, housing for older people and low cost homes ownership housing.

The 2014-15 and 2015-16 data includes the number of homes owned and managed under the same four headings.

The 2016-17 data is provided in three sections: housing stock, rents, and affordable rents. These are the worksheets form the SDR which provide information by local authority area. The full SDR contains much more information, but not by local authority; just by housing provider. Each provider may own and manage homes in a number of local authorities.

organization.name: cambridgeshire-insight
organization.title: Cambridgeshire Insight
organization.description: The Cambridgeshire Insight Partnership is made up of public, health and community bodies to provide a shared research knowledge base for the Cambridgeshire area. It allows users an easy way to access and share data, information and research for deeper insights about their local area. See more at https://cambridgeshireinsight.org.uk

result.title: Private Registered Provider housing in our area

resources.description:
Excel file extracted from the Homes and Communities Agency (HCA) annual return (SDR), to show the number of homes owned and managed by housing providers registered with the HCA, across Cambridgeshire, Peterborough and West Suffolk.

A form is completed by providers registered with the HCA and submitted in March each year, checked by the HCA and published in Autumn each year.

This data comes from the return completed in March 2017 relating to housing owned and managed by providers in 2015-16 listing, released in November 2017.

The 2017 release on Cambridgeshire Insight is split into three parts: housing stock, rents and affordable rents. Each of the three areas are provided in excel and csv format.

resources.description:
Extracted from the Homes and Communities Agency (HCA) annual returns, to show the number of homes owned and managed by Providers registered with the HCA, which includes housing associations, across Cambridgeshire, Peterborough and West Suffolk. A form is completed by Providers and submitted in March each year, checked by the HCA and published in September that year. This data comes from the return completed in March 2015.

Version 2 corrects some coding errors in the original file, but contains exactly the same data.

resources.name: Private Registered Provider housing 2014-15

resources.description:
XLS file of Private Registered Provider housing in the Cambridge housing sub-region 2014/15. This data is based on the Homes and Communities Agency (HCA) Statistical Data Return or SDR; the latest release is based on data from the 2013/14 return as at 31 March 2014 The full data spreasheet is available at http://www.homesandcommunities.co.uk/ourwork/sdr-statistical-releases

This local directory simply seeks to demonstrate the range of housing providers active in the seven districts of our sub-region and the main "types" of housing these providers own and manage. Additionally the directory provides a web address for each provider and a count of the number of distrcits, within our group of 7, which this organisation owns / manages homes within.

The source data includes numbers of homes each organisation owns and manages. In this directory we simply highlight whether the organisations owns or manages ANY homes in our area due ot some of the complexities around the numbers reported. Click here for a definition of stock figures used in the source SDR The SDR is updated annually and published around September each year. It is currently publised at (HCA webiste) however will be moving to .gov.uk imminently. Before the next update is issued the the HCA, there will be changes to stock numbers due to conversions, demolitions and new build. There are also likely to be changes to the Providers (merging, forming groups, closing etc) during the year, but the data in this directory looks only to the SDR. Our local directory will be updated annually, as and when the HCA publishes its annual data.
resources.name: Private Registered Provider housing in our area 2013-14
